primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement from the 'poisonous reality' of sin (uncovered/exposed) to the state of being 'blessed' (covered/forgiven) through the substitutionary work of Christ.

subject.identificatie: God (specifically Jesus Christ in the climax)
tekstueel_bewijs: And you forgave the guilt of my sin
Jesus Christ was uncovered for me
He's the real true love, because he can always get the stain out
Blessed is the one whose transgressions are forgiven, whose sins are covered

zender.identificatie: The Holy God / The Bible (as the straightedge)
tekstueel_bewijs: The clear standard has to be what God thinks
You need to believe the Bible is true
Father, accept me because of what Jesus did

helper.identificatie: The Gospel / The Bible / True Confession
tekstueel_bewijs: The Bible... will teach us three things

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin as a Cosmic Power (Self-assertion) and False Confession (Self-pity/Self-flagellation)
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described as an active inclination to 'break stuff' and a 'poisonous reality' that requires the death of the Son of God to overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The transformation of the heart (Sanctification) where the believer begins to hate sin and love God.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer (empowered by the Cross)
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Hating the sin itself / Changing the heart
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics/change) is explicitly presented as a consequence of the primary program (grace/forgiveness).

voorbeelden_god_subject: Jesus Christ was uncovered for me
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We don't like to talk about sin
You need to take full responsibility

voorbeelden: You must be controlled by bit and bridle
I realized the reason I wanted to steal
You start to hate the sin
The Bible... will teach us three things
He can always get the stain out
God is greater than our hearts

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Pouvoir' (Power) of God to do what the human 'Devoir' (Obligation) cannot achieve.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the 'Uncovered' state of modern guilt (S2) to the failure of 'Self-Covering' (~S1), then to Christ being 'Uncovered' (S2) so the sinner can be 'Covered' (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Substitutionary atonement: Christ takes S2 to provide S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; exposure is described as 'hell' and 'intolerable'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is structurally theocentric. While it calls for human action (confession), it grounds the possibility and efficacy of that action entirely in the finished work of Christ.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Focus on human effort in confession
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: You need to take full responsibility for what you've done wrong.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the Subject of Salvation
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus Christ was uncovered for me... He paid the price.
God has to forgive you... It would be unjust for him not to.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: David is used as a fellow-sufferer and recipient of grace, not a moral hero to emulate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: God saves David, God justifies Paul.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from guilt and 'the voice' of condemnation.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic justification leads to psychological liberation.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the problem of sin to the solution in Christ is logically and narratively seamless.
spanning_punten: The tension between God's justice and mercy is resolved through the 'legal' payment of Christ.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He was uncovered so that our sins could be covered.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses more on Christological work than Pneumatological indwelling.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is a 'poisonous reality' that 'breaks stuff' and requires death to fix.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the primary Subject of the saving action.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly low on the 'how-to' of the secondary program (sanctification).
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Increase 'Pouvoir' of the Spirit in the daily life of the believer.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Explicitly link the Holy Spirit's power to the 'hating of sin'.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Strongly defined as both internal impulse and external condemnation.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in grace-centered preaching that uses structural analysis to dismantle modern secular guilt and replace it with the 'Covering' of Christ.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the use of Kafka and Sartre; semiotic analysis reveals these are 'Opponents' (voices of condemnation) that only the 'Subject' (Christ) can defeat.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the Hebrew words pesha and chata'ah; semiotics shows how these words function as the 'Lack' that initiates the narrative arc.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that the 'True Love' in the fairy tale is a functional equivalent to the 'Subject' in the soteriological program.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses a 'Subject-switch' where the hearer's attempt to cover themselves fails, and Christ becomes the Subject who covers them.
